title: Michelle Trim
text:
With a background in theories of technology, rhetoric, technical communication, and a variety of other disciplinary interests, I want to use my skills to help others develop a critical lens for technology’s impact on society. Empowering people to shape technology to suit their needs, rather than be shaped by it, continues to be a key motivator in my teaching, university service, volunteer, and scholarly work.



University of Massachusetts Amherst
M.S. Data Analytics and Computational Social Science (expected Feb 2025) 
Michigan Technological University
Ph.D. Rhetoric and Technical Communication  Emphasis in Theories of Technology, Rhetoric, Composition, Pedagogy, Technical Communication (Dissertation Directed by Dr. Marilyn Cooper, “Ethics of Service Learning in Writing Intensive Courses: A Critical Discourse Analysis”)
Miami University of Ohio
 M.A. English: Rhetoric and Composition  Emphasis in Rhetoric, Composition Pedagogy, Computing-integrated Writing Instruction Minor Emphasis in 19th-20th Century American Women Writers
Purdue University
 B.A. with Majors in English and Professional Writing  Minor Women’s Studies



2013-pres Senior Lecturer II, Manning College of Information and Computer Sciences (CICS), University of Massachusetts, Amherst. Lecturer 2013-2019; Senior Lecturer II 2019-pres.
2012-2013 Assistant Professor and Director of First-Year Writing, English Department, University of New Haven, West Haven, Connecticut.
2007-2012 Lecturer in English, English Department, Elon University, Elon, North Carolina. Achieved continuance via rigorous review process in 2011.
2004-2007 Full-time, Visiting Instructor of English, Department of English and Foreign Languages, Lander University, Greenwood, South Carolina.
Thanks for checking out my web site!
